canonical_structure.name: UBX-CFG-DAT-GET
canonical_structure.description: Returns the parameters of the currently defined datum. If no user-defined datum has been set, this will default to WGS84.

fields.name: datumNum
fields.description: Datum number: 0 = WGS84, 0xFFFF = user-defined (extra values are defined for protocol versions less than 13.00)

fields.name: datumName
fields.description: ASCII string: WGS84 or USER (extra values are defined for protocol versions less than 13.00)

fields.name: dx
fields.description: X axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters).

fields.name: dy
fields.description: Y axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters).

fields.name: dz
fields.description: Z axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters).

fields.name: rotX
fields.description: Rotation about the X axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds).

fields.name: rotY
fields.description: Rotation about the Y axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds).

fields.name: rotZ
fields.description: Rotation about the Z axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds).

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Scale change (accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million).

issues: This extraction refers to the Poll form (UBX-CFG-DAT-POLL) of the message, which has a 0-byte payload, rather than the GET/SET 52-byte payload.
Minor inconsistent casing for rotx and roty (lowercase x/y).
Minor inconsistent casing for rotx and roty (lowercase x/y).
Minor inconsistent casing for rotx and roty (lowercase x/y).
Descriptions for datumNum and datumName lack mentions of protocol versions >= 13.00, which is correct for this older hardware generation.
Unit symbol for rotation fields is expanded to 'milli-arc seconds' whereas other manuals use 's' or 'S'.

valid_variations.reason: UBX configuration messages often have a 'Poll' variant with the same Class and ID but a zero-length payload.
Protocol versions earlier than 13.00 (e.g., u-blox 8) do not include backward compatibility notes regarding protocol version 13 change sets in their descriptions.

adjudication.reasoning: The message UBX-CFG-DAT (0x06 0x06) has three forms: a Poll (0 bytes), a Set (52 bytes, Input), and a Get (52 bytes, Output). The extractions provided are mostly for the GET variant. Variations across extractions are primarily cosmetic, involving capitalization of field names (rotX vs rotx) and representation of units (s, S, or milli-arc seconds). Extraction 1 correctly identifies the Poll form, which is a valid protocol variation of the same Class/ID.
